ai.summary: A scenic 12.6 km moderate hike along the historic Coffin Road in Kirkton of Glenisla, Scotland. The route follows the River Isla through open moorland and quiet woodland, with gentle hills and rewarding river views. Suitable for hikers with some experience seeking a full-day outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly well-marked tracks and quiet lanes beside the River Isla. Expect a mix of compact paths, occasional muddy patches, and a few rocky sections. Elevation gains are gradual rather than steep, with variable conditions depending on rainfall.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in Scotland can change rapidly. Check forecasts before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layered, weather-appropriate clothing. Carry a map and compass (or reliable GPS) and ensure your phone is charged. Inform someone of your route and expected return time. Stay on marked paths; be cautious on muddy or slippery sections. In winter, plan for shorter daylight and icy conditions.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (fleece, hat, gloves as needed)
Map and compass (or GPS) and a charged phone
Sun protection (hat, sunglasses, sunscreen) as appropriate
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October); winter hiking is possible with full winter gear and extra caution.
